data.title: My Favorite Mexican Restaurant I
data.text:
Just spent a week traveling thru Texas. Couldn't wait to get back to ECC for excellent Mexican food. I love their enchiladas with red mole. Have been going here for many years and when craving Mexican. The restaurant is no frills in a small shopping center.
For ever they have had the $5.99 lunch special. At lunch time they are packed.

data.title: Delicious Mexican food
data.text: Very fast and nice service. All woman working there which is nice to see. The food is amazing. Especially the bean dip and chips.

data.title: Juarez
data.text:
I have been going to this restaurant for years. Am pretty satisfied with the food most of the time. we're all entitled to an off day.

nt for years

data.title: Different
data.text: So my first trip here was a bust... I was put off by the order at the counter and seat yourself thing...This time I gave it a try. Let me tell you the only reason this place gets a three is because the service is terrible!!! We ordered at the counter and sat ourselves. When our order came my burrito was on a plate and my husbands was wrapped in foil and sitting on my plate with mole all over the foil. RUDE! But the Carnitas was DELICIOUS so all is forgiven I guess... Still think people deserve plates but Ill take great food over great service any day...

data.title: Great food
data.text: Have been going to this restaurant in Pittsburg where it started and continued to go there when it moved to antioch. Great food and good Service.

data.title: Good Mexican food in Antioch
data.text: Good Mexican food reasonably priced in Antioch. I always call ahead for take out.  Food always ready and never a wait.

data.title: Beef Nachos
data.text:
I ordered the Beef nachos years ago and got a surprise.
It had like shredded pot roast mix in with the cheese and chips.
It was really a good portion and very good.
Juarez's was in Pittsburg then, now they are in Antioch.
I had the Super Pork Burrito at the Antioch location.
It was really good.
The prices are decent.

data.title: Great Mexican food, best in town
data.text: I wanted Mexican food and had happened to see this place the other day while on another journey. I stopped in to see if it was good and was scared, the line was clear t the door for service. I asked a couple of customers who happened to be Hispanic if the food was any good and got a unanimous YES. So that being said, I stayed. The line moved very fast so I decided to eat-in. It only took a few minutes to get my food, (delivered to the table, not my name or number being yelled out)...now this was at 6:00 PM. I got a 1/2 pork burrito dinner and a drink and could not finish it all because there was so much. I got the burrito, beans and rice and all for under $10.00. The food was hot and had excellent taste. I highly recommend this one.

data.title: YUMMY
data.text: Its all good here. Greasy Burgers, and Crisp French Fries. Dont eat here if you have heart issues, probally not good for your heart..but still GOOD FOOD

data.title: Good not Great
data.text: Stopped in because a friend of mine said it was good. Kind of a shabby looking place but that didn't bother me because some of the best food comes from these little hole in the wall places. Not true for Juarez. The food was OK. Not great but not terrible either.  Just really average.  Bland and very Americanized. I also didn't like the fact that they charge extra for chips & salsa when you dine in and with NO refills. Who does that? No other Mex restaurant in town that I know of. That's just poor customer service. Not a fan of that policy.

data.title: No Frills Mexican
data.text:
This is one of those little hole in the wall Mexican restaurants that you either love or hate. It's located on the corner of 18th and A St. in the old Swensen's ice cream parlor location. It's kind of shabby and could really use some sprucing up but the food is decent. A lot of people think it's not authentic because the food is on the mild or bland side. I don't agree. I don't like my Mexican food very hot & spicy anyway so for me it's just right. My husband doesn't like it at all. He 
won't even go there. So I'm on my own when I visit Juarez. 
They have all the standard fare as far as Mexican food goes, and it's all pretty good. My favorite is the steak fajita burrito. It's pretty plain, just meat, green bell peppers and onions but I like it. I also like their Fajitas. There again, no-frills, they come with just rice and beans. My husband thinks they're too expensive for what you get at $11. But I think it's pretty good size serving so I don't mind. 
They could use a little friendlier people at the counter when you order too.  
The ladies at the counter can be a little on the grumpy side so make sure you know what you want when its your turn or you'll get the "Soup Nazi" attitude.

The only thing I don't like about 
Juarez is they are kind of cheap. And I don't mean cheap as in prices. They are the only Mexican restaurant in the whole town that charges extra for Salsa & Chips. This is something new that they just implemented at the end of 2012.  At that time they raised their prices overall and started charging an extra $2 for a small portion of chips 
and salsa with NO refills. It's kind 
of a tradition around here that Chips & Salsa are included as part of your dine in meal so I've noticed 
It doesn't seem as busy as it used to be. I don't understand the 
reasoning behind this because it's obvious it has affected their 
business. I've actually seen 
customers walk out once they see 
the sign "Chips & Salsa $1.99. NO REFILLS"

data.title: Our local go to place for chick tostadas
data.text: If you call for take-out, depending on time of day, pick up ready within ten to twenty minutes. Highly recommend chicken tostada with whole beans.  When we bring home for dinner, we add more chopped tomatoes.  We do not order with avocado, add when we get to the house. When we add a small bean dip, more than enough for two people!  They also make a great chorizo and egg burrito for breakfast!  Great prices, value!

data.title: Great little walk-in, take-out place
data.text: I love their regular beef tacos, and that every order (dine in and take out) comes with chips and salsa.  I love their mild salsa; it manages to be flavorful without being spicy.

data.title: great food!
data.text: love everything! great to go service! Orders are always right!

data.title: Authenic Tex-Mex food
data.text: Eat here often.  Prices are very reasonable and staff have a positive attitude
